multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: equities; S&P 500 gains reflect broader equity market sentiment, driven by strong earnings from tech and consumer companies.

category.motivation: The article reports Q3 earnings beat for Broadcom and Q2 earnings beat for DocuSign, directly describing company earnings results.

impact.motivation: The article reports significant moves in the Nasdaq Composite and S&P 500, directly affecting the index node.

article_node.title: AVGO, LULU, OPEN, DOCU, NEON: 5 Trending Stocks Today - Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO), Docusign (NASDAQ:DOCU)
article_node.summary: U.S. equities rose on Thursday, with the Nasdaq Composite gaining over 200 points and the S&P 500 up 0.8%, driven by strong earnings from Broadcom and DocuSign. Broadcom shares climbed 1.23% after reporting Q3 revenue and earnings that beat expectations, while DocuSign gained 0.45% on a solid Q2 earnings beat. Lululemon surged 3.81% on the day but fell 16% after-hours after the company cut its 2025 outlook, and Opendoor jumped 16% following a large CEO share sale that helped the stock avoid delisting. Neonode’s shares collapsed 71% after news of a pending patent‑lawsuit settlement, underscoring the volatility of tech stocks amid earnings and regulatory catalysts.
